alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 22 at 3:05AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM HST THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...The island of Hawaii in Hawaii County. * WHEN...Until 615 AM HST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding on roads, poor drainage areas, and in streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 302 AM HST, radar indicated heavy rain over the windward section of the Big Island. Rain was falling at a rate of 1 to 2 inches per hour from Waipio Valley southward. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hilo, Hawaiian Paradise Park, Honokaa, Papaikou, Mountain View, Pepeekeo, Honomu, Glenwood, Keaau, Hakalau, Volcano, Ninole, Hawaiian Acres, Orchidlands Estates, Laupahoehoe, Ookala, Pahoa, Paauilo and Hawaii Volcanoes National Park. This advisory may need to be extended beyond 615 AM HST if flooding persists.
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, drainage ditches and low lying areas prone to flooding.
